intro: Cryptantha clevelandii var. florosa, commonly known as Cleveland's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Cryptantha clevelandii var. florosa is often found in rocky slopes and open woodlands.
